qas.question: What access showcases for players to be seen by pro teams?
What type of exhibition game do freshmen normally playing?

context: <b5_0>High school football teams<b5_0/> frequently participate in controlled scrimmages with other teams during preseason practice, but exhibition games are rare because of <b7_0>league rules and concerns about finances, travel and player injuries<b7_0/>, along with enrollments not being registered until the early part of August in most school districts under the traditional <a0_0>September–June<a0_0/> academic term. A more common exhibition is the high school football <a1_0><b6_0><b8_0><b9_0>all-star<a1_0/> game<b9_0/><b8_0/><b6_0/>, which brings together top players from a region. These games are typically played by <a2_0>graduating seniors<a2_0/> during the summer or at the end of the season. Many of these games, which include the <a3_0>U.S. Army All-American Bowl and Under Armour All-America Game<a3_0/>, are used as showcases for players to be seen by <a4_0>colleges<a4_0/>.
